topic.title: How to Add a Group of Topics to the Footer

indexterm.product: author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse

body.p: To create a footer that contains the content of several topic files, but only on the last page, there are two possible approaches:

section.title: Method 1: Using the position:fixed CSS Property

ol.li: Group all the footer topics under a single parent topic, under the last topic from your DITA map. For example, you can have the following map structure: ... End topic Footer container topic Footer content topic 1 Footer content topic 2
Add an outputclass=footer on the topic root element of the footer container topic, or on its topicref in the map.

section.note: Make sure the width and height are enough for the content of the footer to fit. Be careful because the content might bleed out of the page. Use bottom and left values to position the block in the page.
